column68:
About Us
Blue Power Partners is supporting worldwide leading developers, asset owners and technology companies within origination, development, construction and performance optimization of onshore/offshore wind, solar, PtX and storage projects.
Working at Blue Power Partners means being part of an international company and working alongside people with a broad range of skills, from a variety of cultures.

column100:
Blue Power Partners is looking for a proactive multitasker to support our management team for a 12 months maternity cover. We are a global consultancy and project development company focused on developing renewable energy. This development started five years ago and today, we are proud to have successfully onboarded more than 230 colleagues worldwide. 
 About the Role 
 You will cooperate closely with our management team and support them daily with administrative, practical and business-oriented tasks. 
 In this role, you will interface with many colleagues worldwide and will have to pick up diverse and varying requirements without compromising quality.  
 Your accountabilities are likely to vary, but your main tasks may include: 
 
 Everyday communication, support, and coordination across the department team 
 Close cooperation with IT and BS team 
 Responsibility for calendar management 
 Planning and participating in meetings and creating an overview of action points and deadlines 
 Preparing PowerPoint presentations and printing materials 
 Registration and approval of hours, invoices, vacation, absence, expenses 
 Weekly reports of hour data for department  
 Office management (interior and seating, office stationery, and main contact to various sub-suppliers) 
 Organization of meetings with partners (time, place, accommodation, restaurants) 
 Travel arrangements 
 
 We offer you a challenging job in an informal working environment. Our offices in Aalborg, Vejle and Copenhagen will be your primary places of working. However, we are a global company with a global mindset, so all our positions require flexibility from time. 
 About You 
 You enjoy taking the initiative and possess strong problem-solving skills with a natural curiosity for acquiring new knowledge.  
 You bring a can-do-attitude to our team, and you enjoy working in a flexible and agile environment where no two days are the same.  
 We also expect you to enrich our business with the following competencies and skills: 
 
 Relevant experience from an executive assistant role, legal secretary role, or similar – preferably from an international company/ environment 
 Extensive experience with navigating in a client-driven organization 
 Proven experience with comprehending a specialized business area with the purpose to prioritize on behalf of management 
 Flair for IT and experience with Microsoft Office 365 
 Fluent in English - written and verbal  
 Positive and professional interpersonal skills  
 Use to handle confidential information and materials 
 Collaborative and service-minded team player
